page.title: 02Blandford - Town Council
page.content: In 1605 ten days after the gunpowder plot King James 1 granted a charter to the people of Blandford confirming a Council of 10 men for the Borough to be presided over by a bailiff.Markets on Saturdays & fairs at special times could continue as in the past 400 yrs. In 1835 the Council was increased to 16 & the Bailiff became Mayor.The town's area & population was small but in 1889,1930 &1985 the boundaries were enlarged. On 6th May,1985 a ceremony of'Beating of the Bounds'marked the new edge of the town with posts erected & the Mayor going from one to another tapping them with willow wands.At each point 2 boys were tapped (beaten) so they would recall the boundaries. The Mayor is chosen from the 16 councillors. He is attended by a Mace Bearer & on special occasions wears a chain of office & red robes.
